page.title: 16The School Fifty Years Ago
page.content: In 1935 the majority of the children who left school at the age of fourteen went into work in service or on the land.However,only a very small proportion went to work professionally or in clerical work,other wise people went on to a variety of occupations such as van delivery,farm work,gardening,teaching and carpentry. During the early part of the Autumn term,the older children spent a week picking hops or harvesting potatoes. Gardening and basketry were two major items in the curriculum.The school then had two large classes,taught by the headmaster and an assistant teacher.
